messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Stepping in the hornet's poop (actually about  Harry  Potter, kinda)
messages.messageBody:
<< was he in the music scene at all?

My husband is a muscian and played in
alb/nm/4 corners area, etc. for years, until
we moved out here. >>

So do you know John Truitt?
He was my recorder teacher.
(He would laugh and say I taught myself, but he's not right.)

He used to play in rock bands, and does woodwinds (sax, clarinet) and also
Flamenco guitar and jazz and Renaissance. I had the biggest crush on him in
college...

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Stepping in the hornet's poop (actually about  Harry  Potter, kinda)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/28/01 12:09:01 PM, joylyn@gte.net writes:  Not rock. He used to do Singout (local and convention,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/28/01 12:09:01 PM, joylyn@... writes:

<< was he in the music scene at all? >>

Not rock.

He used to do Singout (local and convention, never a real up with people
cast, although I have other friends from Santa Clara Pueblo who toured), and
madrigal stuff. He did musicals in high school but in college just
drama/comedy. We've done a couple of performance things, not lately--one
Shakespearean thing for the Albuquerque museum, and a Renaissance Christmas
trio (with Pati Nagle, who writes about the Civil War and plays Middle
Eastern with Sazlar now and is lost to us for Renaissance stuff) at a
now-defunct restaurant called Sadies.

Sandra
